creator.name: Bank Insinger & Co
creator.his_func: The firm of Insinger and Prins was established after acceptance of a commission to travel to the Danish colonial possessions of St Thomas, St John, and St Croix as representatives of an investor in Caribbean plantations. Initially, the firm was planning to enter into the Caribbean consignment trade (consignatiehandel), but over time the company, also became interested in investment and plantation mortgages besides commodity trade. During the 19th century the bank became the owner of a number of plantations in Suriname.
